Behind Gaza's 'yellow line,' Israel's postwar laboratory
subhead: In the half of the Palestinian enclave kept under Israeli army control, several hundred members of anti-Hamas militias and criminal gangs have been brought together. Israeli authorities intend to rely on these groups to counter the Islamist movement.
byline: By Louis Imbert and Marie Jo Sader

War in Ukraine: Trump's envoy makes no progress with Putin
subhead: 'So far we haven't found a compromise, but some American solutions can be discussed,' said Yuri Ushakov, the diplomatic adviser to the Russian president, who earlier in the day threatened war with the rest of Europe.

title: Algerian court upholds French journalist's seven-year prison sentence
subhead: Sports journalist Christophe Gleizes has been detained in Algeria since 2024, accused of 'glorifying terrorism.' The ruling dashed hopes raised by a recent diplomatic thaw and leaves a presidential pardon as his last path to release.
byline: By Brice Laemle, Simon Roger and Hamid Nasri

title: 'Mektoub, My Love: Canto Due': Abdellatif Kechiche's Mediterranean gem
subhead: The director of 'Blue Is the Warmest Color' is releasing the final installment of his trilogy set in Sète, weaving a tale of intrigue and burning desire. It is a film of reconciliations and reunions, with characters who never fail to surprise.

title: Negotiating peace: A chaotic art with no established rules
subhead: Donald Trump, casting himself as mediator in the Russia-Ukraine war, has been pushing Kyiv and European leaders to accept his 'peace plan,' drafted with Moscow. His seemingly erratic approach reveals a deeper issue: the absence of any standards governing peace processes.

'Nighttime prohibition': Warsaw city center bans alcohol sales at night
subhead: Nearly 180 municipalities in Poland have already opted to ban the sale of alcohol at night. On November 1, two central districts in Warsaw followed suit. The measure, which was initially intended to apply across the entire capital, has sparked heated debate.

title: The significant trade imbalance between France and China
subhead: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.
byline: By Harold Thibault (Shanghai (China) special correspondent) and Jordan Pouille (Beijing (China), correspondent)

title: Jodie Foster: 'Without cinema, I would have been rigid, dry and much more solitary'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a figure about a decisive moment in their life. The American actress pays tribute to her mother, with whom she shared a close, almost inseparable bond for many years.
byline: Interview by Annick Cojean and Vanessa Schneider
